author: Staff Reporter
text:
The police arrested eight persons in connection with hurling country-made bombs on a functionary of the Tamizhaga Vazhvurimai Katchi (TVK) and seven others on January 22. Police sources said Arumugam (40), deputy youth wing secretary of the Tamizhaga Vazhvurimai Katchi (TVK) was the prime accused in the murder of Thirumalaivasan, a PMK functionary in 2013.

Arumugam along with seven others had appeared before a Judicial Magistrate court in Villupuram in connection with the murder case on January 22. As he was proceeding towards Kallipattu in a car, two unidentified persons hurled two-country made bombs on the car, damaging the windscreen of one of the cars. However, no one was injured. The miscreants chased the vehicles and hurled two more country-made bombs.

A special police team arrested Karthikeyan, Dina, Tamilalagan, Kumaravel, Vaithianathan, Murali Sarathy and Gerald at Koliyanur on Saturday and recovered 3 bombs and 2 sickles from them.
title: 8 held for hurling country-made bombs at TVK cadre
